summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Maxwell, transmitting attached documents. It appears to be routine legal correspondence regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.

persons.name: Christian Everdell

events.title: Prosecution Correspondence to Defense
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney sends an email with attachments to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel.

locations.context: The address of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, from which the correspondence was sent.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 25, 2020, from a federal prosecutor to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.
It confirms the active legal proceedings in United States v. Maxwell as of late 2020.
The email transmits attached documents, which are likely court filings or evidence related to the Maxwell case.
The defense team at this time included attorneys Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, and Bobbi Sternheim.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, the office prosecuting the case.
